headline.main: Zen and the Art of Dying Well

docs.lead_paragraph: The young woman nursing a fresh black eye has come to the police station in this old fishing city for help. But she's not looking to report a crime or seek someone's arrest. She wants help kicking her heroin addiction.

headline.main: Addict Amnesty: Police Give Heroin Addicts Support, Rehab
headline.print_headline: Addict Amnesty: Police Give Heroin Addicts Support, Rehab

docs.lead_paragraph: Fixing the tax code for U.S. businesses will be at the forefront  when Congress returns from vacation next month, with many lawmakers focusing on "C" corporations, despite new data showing a continuing decline in their numbers.

headline.main: Corporate Taxes to Be Major Agenda Item When Congress Returns

docs.lead_paragraph: A Connecticut judge on Thursday approved the largest portion yet of a settlement in which the estate of the mother of the gunman who carried out a 2012 massacre at Sandy Hook Elementary school will pay out $1.5 million to families of 16 victims.

headline.main: Judge OKs Settlement With Families of Newtown Massacre Victims
headline.print_headline: Judge OKs Settlement With Families of Newtown Massacre Victims

docs.lead_paragraph: Nearly a million people signed up for health insurance under President Barack Obama's law even after the official enrollment season ended, helping push the share of uninsured Americans below 10 percent and underscoring how hard it could be for Republicans to dismantle the program.

headline.main: Health Law Sign-Ups Keep Growing; Uninsured Rate Declines

docs.lead_paragraph: In every strip club I’ve worked in, it’s the same: We’re exploited.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by author Antonia Crane describes her experience as stripper, profession in which many women suffer exploitation, lack of insurance and job security and other injustices; argues key problem is majority of dancers are independent contractors, status that exposes them to intimidation and tip-skimming; calls for improved conditions.
docs.snippet: In every strip club I’ve worked in, it’s the same: We’re exploited.

docs.lead_paragraph: A patient asks for oxycodone. How do you know if it’s necessary?
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Dr Danielle Ofri describes quandary many doctors face when asked to prescribe strong pain medication to patient; says number of factors, including patient's past use of narcotics, pressures put on doctors and complications of medical system, can make determining viability of request more difficult.
docs.snippet: A patient asks for oxycodone. How do you know if it’s necessary?

docs.lead_paragraph: California paroled a transgender inmate on Wednesday, one day before a federal appeals court was to hear her request for the state prison system to pay for her sex reassignment surgery.

headline.main: Transgender California Inmate Freed From Prison After Parole
headline.print_headline: Transgender California Inmate Freed From Prison After Parole
